attributes.description: This is the work item type that defines the common fields that are shared among all for all work item types of the agile template. It extends the planner item type and thereby already provides a great deal of common fields.

system.area.description: The area to which the work item belongs
system.area.label: Area

system.assignees.description: The users that are assigned to the work item
system.assignees.label: Assignees

system.boardcolumns.description: List of boardcolumns this work item is attached to
system.boardcolumns.label: Boardcolumns

system.codebase.description: Contains codebase attributes to which this WI belongs to
system.codebase.label: Codebase

system.created_at.description: The date and time when the work item was created
system.created_at.label: Created at

system.creator.description: The user that created the work item
system.creator.label: Creator

system.description.description: A descriptive text of the work item
system.description.label: Description

system.iteration.description: The iteration to which the work item belongs
system.iteration.label: Iteration

system.labels.description: List of labels attached to the work item
system.labels.label: Labels

system.metastate.description: The meta-state of the work item
system.metastate.label: Meta State

system.number.description: The unique number that was given to this workitem within its space.
system.number.label: Number

system.remote_item_id.label: Remote item

attributes.name: Impediment

attributes.description: A bug that causes unexpected behavior in the software.

environment.label: Environment

priority.description: The order in which the developer should resolve a defect.
priority.label: Priority

resolution.description: The reason why this defect's state was last changed.
resolution.label: Resolution

severity.description: The degree of impact that a defect has on the operation of the product or impact on security.
severity.label: Severity

attributes.name: Task

attributes.description: Incremental work or requirements identified to deliver a product feature. Typically, it is expressed from the user's perspective in the following format - As a user, I want to achieve an objective, so that this purpose is met.

acceptance_criteria.description: The acceptance criteria describes rules for checking if a chunk of work is completed.
acceptance_criteria.label: Acceptance criteria

component.description: The component for this area of work.
component.label: Component

storypoints.description: The effort needed to implement this user story.
storypoints.label: Storypoints

attributes.name: Story

attributes.description: A large user story, with a focused goal, that may need to be split into multiple user stories spanning over multiple iterations to be realized. It could comprise a short statement or phrase, a coherent aggregation of user stories and requirements, or an idea.
